com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class BaseLayerSource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayerSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
LayerSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseImageLayerSource, BaseWorkspaceLayerSource
Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.

public abstract class BaseLayerSource
extends Object
implements LayerSource

Manages the LayerInfo provided by sub-classes. It is expected that a LayerSource sub-class will construct LayerInfo objects within the refresh() method, and will typically call clear() first to remove all existing LayerInfo objects, then call addLayerInfo() for each new Layer.

Manipulating the LayerInfo collection potentially needs to be synchronized, but this is not done here. You might want to manage this by synchronizing access to refresh() for example. The underlying collection is an ArrayList, so the order of Layers obtained by getLayers() is the same that they were inserted from the source, usually obtained during refresh().

BaseLayerSource subclasses are also expected to implement a createLayer() method for a given layerInfo. BaseLayerSource manages the getLayer() and getLayers() methods by calling the createLayer method as necessary. Each time a Layer is created in this way, the Layer's Capabilities are initialized from the LayerInfo details.

makeLayer

protected final Layer makeLayer(LayerInfo linfo)
Deprecated. 
this method is called by getLayer() and getLayers() to construct a Layer based upon the given LayerInfo. It first calls createLayer() so that subclasses can construct the Layer appropriately, then calls setupLayer() to associate the LayerSource and LayerInfo with the Layer as well as setup the LayerCapabilities obtained from the LayerInfo

Parameters:
linfo - the LayerInfo
Returns:
the new layer

createLayer

protected abstract Layer createLayer(LayerInfo linfo)
Deprecated. 
Sub-classes must implement this method to allow getLayer() and getLayers() to work. Subclass implementation should create the Layer and setup its attributes such as initial visibility. After the Layer is constructed using createLayer() BaseLayerSource.setupLayer() will be called to further populate the Layer with data from the LayerInfo Capabilities. setupLayer() will also associate the LayerInfo and LayerSource with the Layer - these are tasks that createLayer() need not perform.

Parameters:
linfo - the details of the layer to be created
Returns:
a new Layer
See Also:
setupLayer(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.Layer, com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.LayerInfo)

setupLayer

protected final void setupLayer(Layer layer,
                                LayerInfo linfo)
Deprecated. 
This method is called by makeLayer() after createLayer() and it associates the Layer with the LayerSource and its LayerInfo, and also populates its Capabilities from the LayerInfo.

Parameters:
layer - the layer
linfo - the associated LayerInfo
See Also:
createLayer(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.LayerInfo)
